edu.oakland.mvc.portlet

Class EditController

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.oakland.mvc.portlet.EditController

  • public class EditController
extends java.lang.Object
    Renders the editing interface and persists user selections to the portlet's preferences.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0, 2012-08-30
    Author:
    Aaron Grant

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • setViewSelector

        public void setViewSelector(IViewSelector viewSelector)
        Sets the value of viewSelector in preparation to show the main View.
        Parameters:
        viewSelector - An IViewSelector, which is used in determining whether to use the mobile or desktop theme

      • showMainView

        public ModelAndView showMainView(RenderRequest request,
                        RenderResponse response)
        Returns the edit view. The edit view is a very simple JSP, so no model is necessary or even returned in this case.
        Parameters:
        request - A RenderRequest that contains information about which theme is to be used
        response - A RenderResponse that contains information about how to further render the portlet
        Returns:
        A ModelAndView that holds the model and view used with this controller

      • editPreferences

        public void editPreferences()
        Empty method--there are no editable preferences associated with this portlet.
